Exploring the wonderful region of Ardèche @ardechetourisme and @valleedelagastronomie ⛰️💧🇫🇷

The Ardèche gorges ~ famous for its mountainous landscape, enchanting world of mysterious caves, medieval castles, spectacular waterfalls and beautiful river (perfect for canoeists and kayakers), plus cute little villages and lovely vineyards. Highlights from our time there included…

✓ A private tour of @grottechauvet2 - where we learned all about the first cave art - made over 36,000 years ago 

✓ Lunch with the locals at Auberge la Farigoule - a charming bistrot overlooking vineyards and lavender fields, serving hearty dishes and fantastic desserts.

✓ The most incredible Speleoenology experience @grottesaintmarcel - where we ventured deep into the natural caves and did a blind wine tasting of local wines - including wines aged inside the cave. We also came across some beautiful natural cave pools, which were illuminated by a magical light show.

✓ Super fun wine tasting experience at @domaine_les_amoureuses - where they make some incredible wines aged in amphora. We also loved the local olive oils, chestnut purees and honey. 

✓ A beautiful alfresco dinner, wine and cheese tasting experience, plus an overnight stay @domainedecousignac run by the inspirational organic winemaker Raphael Pommier, where wines are aged with music. Working with local artists and musicians, there is even a different piece of music for each wine blend, composed every year.

Thank you to my wonderful hosts! @ardechetourisme @gorges_ardeche @auvergnerhonealpes.tourisme @valleedelagastronomie @explorefrance
